docs.snippet: PORTLAND, Ore., Aug. 26. -- Judge Robert S. Lovett, Chairman of the Executive Committee of the Board of Directors of the Harriman lines, said to-day that after an inspection of the wheat fields of the country west of the Missouri River he believed...
docs.lead_paragraph: PORTLAND, Ore., Aug. 26. -- Judge Robert S. Lovett, Chairman of the Executive Committee of the Board of Directors of the Harriman lines, said to-day that after an inspection of the wheat fields of the country west of the Missouri River he believed the railroads would be able to handle the crops, though it would tax them to do it.

headline.main: REPUBLICS AID TELLIER.; Uruguay Gives $2,000 to Help Inventor of Meat Refrigeration.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: VALENTINE TH. BULGAKOFF, a young admirer of Leo Tolstoy and at the same time his amanuensis, has published his reminiscences entitled, "With Tolstoy the Last Year of His Life." The book forms a series of snapshots of Tolstoy in his various moods and...
docs.lead_paragraph: VALENTINE TH. BULGAKOFF, a young admirer of Leo Tolstoy and at the same time his amanuensis, has published his reminiscences entitled, "With Tolstoy the Last Year of His Life." The book forms a series of snapshots of Tolstoy in his various moods and occupations and differs from the more voluminous biographies by its straightforwardness and simplicity.

headline.main: WITH TOLSTOY DURING THE LAST YEAR OF HIS LIFE; Valentine Th. Bulgakoff Who Was the Noted Russian's Secretary Writes Intimately of His Final Months and Reveals Him in Many Moods.

docs.snippet: The subjoined article on the Monroe Doctrine and its meaning will be published this week in England, under the title "The Myth of the Monroe Doctrine," in the current number of The Financial Review of Reviews. It is written by Percy F. Martin,...
docs.lead_paragraph: The subjoined article on the Monroe Doctrine and its meaning will be published this week in England, under the title "The Myth of the Monroe Doctrine," in the current number of The Financial Review of Reviews. It is written by Percy F. Martin, described by the Review as "the most prominent English writer on Latin-America."

headline.main: ENGLISH WRITER ASSAILS "THE MONROE DOCTRINE MYTH"; Percy F. Martin Says It Has Failed to Become Recognized as International Law and Doubts if It Ever Will Be.

docs.snippet: HAVANA, Sept. 4. -- Senor Fosalba, Minister from Uruguay and dean of the Diplomatic Corps, handed to Secretary of State Sanguilly to-day a note, the contents of which, while not divulged officially, are known to contain a united request from all the...
docs.lead_paragraph: HAVANA, Sept. 4. -- Senor Fosalba, Minister from Uruguay and dean of the Diplomatic Corps, handed to Secretary of State Sanguilly to-day a note, the contents of which, while not divulged officially, are known to contain a united request from all the diplomats accredited to Cuba that the Cuban Government take up measures to prevent further attacks by the Cuban press on Mr. Gibson, the American Minister, or on other diplomats.
docs.abstract: US Diplomatic Corps in Cuba asks Govt to prevent further Cuban press attacks on Gibson; State Sec agrees to take such action

headline.main: TO CAUTION CUBAN EDITORS.; Sanguilly Will Act on Diplomats' Protest Against Attacks.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: The Banking Department has prepared for distribution at the State Fair in Syracuse this week a book containing a brief history of banking, the principal legal requirements in this State, and other matters of interest. Among these is a sketch of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Banking Department has prepared for distribution at the State Fair in Syracuse this week a book containing a brief history of banking, the principal legal requirements in this State, and other matters of interest. Among these is a sketch of the development of the system of bank examinations from the earliest days to the present comprehensive system under Supt. George C. Van Tuyl, Jr.

headline.main: BANK EXAMINATIONS HAD EARLY BEGINNING; New York Department Traces History of System Back to 1834.

docs.snippet: PARIS, Sept. 6. -- Charles Tellier, the French scientist, who is now the acknowledged inventor of cold storage, will probably pass the twilight of his long career in peace. Already certain South American Republics which his invention has peculiarly...
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, Sept. 6. -- Charles Tellier, the French scientist, who is now the acknowledged inventor of cold storage, will probably pass the twilight of his long career in peace. Already certain South American Republics which his invention has peculiarly benefited, have contributed to the fund started for his relief, so that it now amounts, with individual subscriptions to over $25 000.

headline.main: CHARLES TELLIER FUND OVER $25,000; Aged Inventor of Cold Storage Tells How He Fitted Out Refrigerator Vessel in 1876.

docs.snippet: ONLY six years ago, when Elihu Root as Secretary of State made a tour of South America, it was a National lament that the American business man had allowed this vast and near-by field for commercial expansion to fall to the almost exclusive...
docs.lead_paragraph: ONLY six years ago, when Elihu Root as Secretary of State made a tour of South America, it was a National lament that the American business man had allowed this vast and near-by field for commercial expansion to fall to the almost exclusive cultivation of his European rivals.

headline.main: TWO NEW YORKERS TRY TO HARRIMANIZE SOUTH AMERICA; Percival Farquhar and Dr. F.S. Pearson Seek to Consolidate Railroads There Into a Great Trans-Continental System Road from Canada to Cape Horn.

docs.snippet: ALBERT BIGELOW PAINE'S "Mark Twain: A Biography," has just been published by Harper  Brother. Fugitive chapters from this work appearing from time to time in Harper's Magazine have already gained for it recognition as one of the important biographies...
docs.lead_paragraph: ALBERT BIGELOW PAINE'S "Mark Twain: A Biography," has just been published by Harper Brother. Fugitive chapters from this work appearing from time to time in Harper's Magazine have already gained for it recognition as one of the important biographies of recent years.

headline.main: BOOK NEWS AND NOTES; Biography of Mark Twain -- James Bryce's Travels in South America -- Exploring Mexico and Babylonia
